ExamName: Bai thi trac nghiem Vstep ky nang Listening

Test001.Instructions: Directions: This is the listening test for levels from 3 to 5 of the Vietnam's 6-level Language Proficiency Test. There are three parts to the test. You will hear each part once. For each part of the test there will be time for you to look through the questions and time for you to check your answers. Write your answers on the question paper. You will have 5 minutes at the end of the test to transfer your answers onto the answer sheet.

PART1.Instructions_Part1: There are eight questions in this part. For each question there are four options and a short recording. For each question, choose the correct answer A, B, C or D. You now have 45 seconds to look through the questions and the options in each question.

options.A: a pretty village right by the sea

options.C: a pretty village behind the tall trees

options.D: a pretty village on the hills

question_3.question: What time will the plane to Milan leave?

question_4.question: Which present has the girl bought her mother?

question_5.question: What time will the pie be ready?

question_6.question: What time is the swimming lesson today?

question_7.question: Which subject does the boy like best?

question_8.question: Which T-shirt does the boy decide to buy?

options.A: a short-sleeved T-shirt with round neck

PART2.Instructions_Part2: You will hear three different conversations. In each conversation there are four questions. For each question, choose the correct answer A, B, C or D. You will hear the conversations only once.

conversations.Conversation_1: You will hear a conversation between a girl, Kate, and a boy, George.

question_9.question: What is Kate’s health problem?

question_10.question: How does Kate's problem affect her classmates?

question_11.question: What did Kate have last year?

options.C: She had a fall off her bike

question_12.question: What does Kate have now, too?

conversations.Conversation_2: You will hear a conversation between a man and a woman at home.

question_13.question: Why does the man want to go out?

options.A: Because he feels bored staying at home.

options.B: Because he feels safe staying at home.

options.C: Because he feels cold staying at home.

options.D: Because he feels hot staying at home.

question_14.question: Why does the woman want to stay at home?

question_15.question: Why doesn’t the woman want to watch an Italian film?

options.A: Because she is short of money.

options.C: Because she’s afraid she will fall asleep watching it.

question_16.question: Why doesn’t the woman want to watch a Robert De Niro?

options.A: Because she feels too busy to watch it.

options.B: Because she feels too serious to watch it.

options.C: Because she doesn’t want to watch it the third time.

options.D: Because she doesn’t want to watch it the second time.

conversations.Conversation_3: You will hear a conversation between a girl, Lisa, and a boy, Ben, about holidays.

question_17.question: What does the girl think about a good holiday?

question_18.question: Why doesn't the boy want to walk?

options.A: Because he feels too hot to do it.

options.B: Because he finds it hard to do it.

options.C: Because he doesn't like hard work.

options.D: Because he needs to save energy.

question_19.question: What does the girl think about the food in Youth Hostels?

question_20.question: What does the boy decide to do in the end?

PART3.Instructions_Part3: You will hear three different talks or lectures. In each talk or lecture there are five questions. For each question, choose the correct answer A, B, C or D. You will hear the talks or lectures only once.

talks.Talk_Lecture_1: You will hear a girl talking about her life since she left Vietnam.

question_21.question: Why did the speaker have to help her mother with the shopping?

options.A: There were no Vietnamese people living near her.

options.B: There were no Vietnamese working in the stores.

options.C: There wasn’t always someone to go shopping with her.

options.D: Her mother could speak a little English.

question_22.question: Why did her father find working in a factory difficult?

options.B: He didn’t have many friends there.

options.C: He had had a much better job in Vietnam.

options.D: He couldn’t get used to the working style.

question_23.question: Why are the speaker and her brother more fortunate than their sisters?

options.A: They did not need extra English lessons.

options.D: They quickly adopted the way of life.

question_24.question: What has the speaker forgotten about life in Vietnam?

question_25.question: Why does she find it difficult to invite friends to her home?

options.A: Her parents do not have much money.

options.B: Her parents haven't adopted an American way of life.

options.C: Her parents only know how to cook Vietnamese food.

options.D: Her parents do not speak English well.

talks.Talk_Lecture_2: Listen to a woman talking about boys and girls in American schools.

question_26.question: What happened in American schools before 1972?

options.B: Every classroom was a mix of boys and girls.

options.C: Boys could learn what they wanted.

options.D: They didn't teach girls some subjects.

question_27.question: What is the reason that most American schools have mixed classes?

options.A: Scientists said that it was the best thing.

options.B: Teachers did not want to teach single-gender classes.

options.C: A law gave girls an equal chance to learn.

options.D: Boys and girls behave better in such classes.

question_28.question: Why might girls not get a chance to talk much in a class with boys?

options.A: Because the teacher doesn’t ask them questions

options.B: Because boys are louder and often talk first

options.C: Because boys know the correct answers

question_29.question: What is NOT the reason that some schools are reconsidering separating classes?

options.A: They prefer the old teaching styles.

options.C: Boys and girls can bother each other.

options.D: Boys and girls like different things.

question_30.question: Which is one class that is not mentioned as being separated?

talks.Talk_Lecture_3: Listen to a talk about body language in American Culture at a student orientation meeting.

question_31.question: Who is listening to the orientation talk?

options.D: all first-year students in the college

question_32.question: What is the purpose of this talk?

options.A: to introduce the director for international student affairs

options.B: to deal with all international students' problems.

options.C: to inform the importance of using English in class.

options.D: to introduce common problems in non-verbal communication.

question_33.question: According to the speaker, what is body language?

options.A: It’s the use of verb tenses and modals.

options.B: It’s the way to ask for directions.

options.C: It’s the language used in class only.

options.D: It’s the language of movements and facial expressions.

question_34.question: In American culture, ...

options.A: Eye contact is the same as most cultures.

options.B: making eye contact is a sign of disrespect.

options.C: people don’t look in others’ eyes while talking.

options.D: eye contact is considered as a sign of honesty.

question_35.question: According to the speaker, what is TRUE about handshakes in American Culture?

options.A: A handshake shouldn't be too strong.

PART1.Instructions_Part1: There are eight questions in this part. For each question there are four options and a short recording. For each question, choose the correct answer A, B, C or D. You now have 48 seconds to look through the questions and the options in each question.

question_3.question: What are they going to buy for Pam?

question_4.question: What has the girl lost?

question_5.question: Which sport will the boy do soon at the centre?

question_6.question: Who lives with Josh in his house?

question_7.question: What will the girl take with her on holiday?

question_8.question: Where do the boys decide to go?

PART2.Instructions_Part2: You will hear three different conversations. In each conversation there are four questions. For each question, choose the correct answer A, B, C or D. You will hear the conversations only once.

conversations.Conversation_1: You will hear a journalist interviewing Geoff Thompson, a British sportsman.

question_9.question: Where was Geoff Thompson born?

question_10.question: How did he know about karate?

options.B: He's interested in karate owning to a sports center during a school visit.

options.C: His friend introduced it to him.

options.D: He knew it when moving to London.

question_11.question: When did he take part in the World Championships in Taiwan?

options.D: After starting training with a British coach.

question_12.question: How many times has he got the World Champion?

conversations.Conversation_2: You will hear a man telephoning to talk about the job in a hotel.

question_13.question: Which position does this hotel need?

question_14.question: What about the hour of work?

options.A: There are two shifts and two days off.

options.B: There are two shifts and one day off.

options.C: There's a day shift from 7 to 2 and a late shift from 4 till 11.

question_15.question: What does the woman mention about the uniform?

options.B: He needs to wear dark clothes.

options.C: He needs a white shirt and dark trousers.

options.D: He needs wear uniform five days a week.

question_16.question: When does he start his job?

conversations.Conversation_3: Listen to part of a conversation at a university library.

question_17.question: What does the man plan to write his paper on?

question_18.question: What security procedures does the librarian tell the man he must follow?

options.A: Show her his note cards before leaving.

options.D: Allow his ID card to be copied; sign in and out of the archives room.

question_19.question: Why did the librarian mention the age of the books?

options.A: They need to be handled with gloves.

options.B: The man can only look at photographs of them.

options.C: They were added to the collection recently.

question_20.question: How did the man collect his needed information about his paper?

PART3.Instructions_Part3: You will hear three different talks or lectures. In each talk or lecture there are five questions. For each question, choose the correct answer A, B, C or D. You will hear the talks or lectures only once.

talks.Talk_Lecture_1: You will hear a presentation about fashion at work.

question_21.question: The presenter doesn’t wear a suit because ...

options.A: He is not an important person.

options.B: He wants to talk about different fashion trend.

options.D: He works for a fashion company.

question_22.question: According to the speaker, which statement is TRUE?

options.A: It's important to look casually-dressed in public.

options.B: A suit is necessary when meeting clients.

options.D: Nobody can describe the way he's dressed.

question_23.question: What does the phrase “Dress-down Fridays” mean?

options.A: Employees must wear fashionable clothes on Fridays.

options.B: Employees can wear anything they want on Fridays.

options.C: Employees are allowed to wear informally on Fridays.

options.D: Employees are required to wear special clothes on Fridays.

question_24.question: According to the speaker, who may be the most informal dressers?

question_25.question: What does a customer feel about a man in uniform?

talks.Talk_Lecture_2: Listen to a man talking about sleeping habits.

question_26.question: How many hours of sleep do experts suggest for kids?

question_27.question: According to the speaker, why is sleep important for the brain?

options.A: Sleep generates dreams so brain can relax.

options.B: Brain can rest in a sleep.

options.C: Sleep can save energy for the brain.

options.D: Sleep improves the effectiveness of the brain.

question_28.question: Why don’t the students learn well when they are tired?

options.B: They can’t deal with troubles in class.

options.D: They can't pay attention very well

question_29.question: Which is NOT a reason for poor sleep?

question_30.question: What should students try to do each night?

options.C: Go to bed at a regular time

talks.Talk_Lecture_3: Listen to a woman talking about northern lights.

question_31.question: Which is NOT the shape of the northern lights?

question_32.question: What does “aurora borealis” exactly mean?

question_33.question: Where is the best place to see the northern lights?

question_34.question: What is one of the stories developed by people before modern science?

options.A: The lights were caused by foxes.

options.B: The lights were the dance of animals.

options.D: The lights came from fires of northern gods.

question_35.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned in this talk?

options.B: The scientific explanation for the lights

ExamName: Bai thi trac nghiem Vstep ky nang Listening

PART1.Instructions_Part1: There are eight questions in this part. For each question there are four options and a short recording. For each question, choose the correct answer A, B, C or D. You now have 48 seconds to look through the questions and the options in each question.

question_1.question: Which box of chocolates do they buy?

question_3.question: How much petrol does the woman want?

question_4.question: What time is the woman’s hair appointment?

question_5.question: Where’s the TV guide?

question_6.question: What does the man decide to take Tracy?

question_7.question: Which sport has the man just started?

question_8.question: What was damaged in the storm?

PART2.Instructions_Part2: You will hear three different conversations. In each conversation there are four questions. For each question, choose the correct answer A, B, C or D. You will hear the conversations only once.

conversations.Conversation_1: You will listen to a conversation between a boy John and a girl Louise

question_9.question: What are they both doing here?

options.D: to dance in a musical show

question_10.question: What does John think of Mrs Thompson?

question_11.question: What does John imply about his performance?

options.A: He does well in a real show

question_12.question: What does Louise think of a musical show?

options.C: she thinks she will try it

conversations.Conversation_2: Listen to the conversation and answer the questions

question_13.question: How many children competed for roles in the show?

question_14.question: What was the first success of Olivia?

options.C: When she got the leading role

options.D: After she visited the local theatre

question_15.question: How did Olivia practice for the role in Annie?

question_16.question: What did Jackie feel about her daughter’s performance?

conversations.Conversation_3: Listen to a conversation between an English teacher, Paul and a foreign student in his course, Kira.

question_17.question: What is true about Kira?

options.B: She started a course in Pharmacy over again.

options.C: She is a third year student

options.D: She will finish her course in 12 months

question_18.question: What does she think about her course now?

options.B: it is similar to the course she did

question_19.question: Why does she say her assignment is difficult?

options.A: She is not familiar with it

options.B: she is expected to be critical

question_20.question: What does she mean about lecturers in her country?

options.B: You can talk to them easily

options.D: It’s hard to discuss with them

PART3.Instructions_Part3: You will hear three different talks or lectures. In each talk or lecture there are five questions. For each question, choose the correct answer A, B, C or D. You will hear the talks or lectures only once.

talks.Talk_Lecture_1: You do not have to provide

question_21.question: You do not have to provide..........

question_22.question: Your required English level depends on..........

question_23.question: Some science courses require you to..........

options.D: have a higher level of English.

question_24.question: Application for undergraduate courses is..........

options.C: either via UCAS or direct with universities.

question_25.question: British universities..........

options.A: are the best in the world.

options.B: rank among the top universities in the world.

talks.Talk_Lecture_2: You will hear a man called Dan Pearman talking on the radio about Pedal Power, a UK charity which sends bicycles to people in developing countries

question_26.question: In 1993 Dan Pearman went to Ecuador ..........

question_27.question: Dan's neighbour was successful in business because he ..........

options.B: was the most skilled craftsman in the town.

options.C: found it easy to reach customers.

question_28.question: Dan says the charity relies on ..........

options.A: getting enough bicycles to send regularly.

options.B: finding new areas which need the bicycles.

options.C: charging for the bicycles it sends abroad.

options.D: getting the second-hand bikes from the rich.

question_29.question: What does Dan say about the town of Rivas?

options.A: It has received the greatest number of bikes.

options.B: It has almost as many bikes as Amsterdam.

options.C: Its economy has been totally transformed.

question_30.question: What problem did the charity face in August 2000?

options.B: It had to delay sending the bikes.

options.C: It was criticised in British media.

options.D: It didn’t get enough bikes ready to send.

talks.Talk_Lecture_3: You’re going to hear a radio talk on back pain given by doctor Paula Clayburg of Liverpool’s Wilton Clinic.

question_31.question: According to the speaker, the main cause of back pain in women is..........

question_32.question: As treatment for back pain the Clinic mainly recommends ..........

question_33.question: The back is different from other parts of the body because ..........

options.A: it is usually better at self-repair.

options.B: a back injury is usually more painful.

options.C: its response to injury often results in more damage.

options.D: it is worse if we keep the back as immobile as possible.

question_34.question: Bed rest is advised ..........

options.A: for a maximum of two days.

options.C: for pain lasting more than two days.

question_35.question: Being overweight ..........

options.A: is a major source of back pain.

options.D: is the only cause of back pain.
